channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2124] A Message to Annoying Neighbor via Network Connections (PIC)
item.description: A clever way to piss off people stealing your internet

item.title: [+1134] Republican Deficit Hypocrisy
item.description: The human capacity for self-delusion never ceases to amaze me, so it shouldn't surprise me that so many Republicans seem to genuinely believe that they are the party of fiscal responsibility.

item.title: [+1051] How LED Tattoos Could Change The Face of Humanity
item.description: New LED tattoos from the University of Pennsylvania could make the Illustrated Man real (minus the creepy stories, of course). Researchers there are developing silk and silicon implantable devices which sit under the skin like a tattoo. Already implanted into mice, these tattoos could carry LEDs, turning the wearer’s skin into a screen.

item.title: [+1033] One in a Million, Split Second OMG's
item.description: Near misses, once in a lifetime events and a few OMG moments make this a great video!

item.title: [+1013] PETA Slaughters Lobsters for Cookout
item.description: I remember a time when PETA actually stood for something. A time where the animals had someone to look after them, protect them and truly care for them. After hearing about the slaughter of innocent lobsters by the hand that swore to protect them, however, I broke down and cried. Woe to the animals, PETA their protector has forsaken

item.title: [+988] Mick Foley & Jon Stewart Don't Appreciate Your Homo Hating
item.description: If you want to call William Phillips a gaywad, you'll have to get through Mick Foley first.

item.title: [+797] 7 Popular 'Chick Flicks' That Secretly Hate Women
item.description: Hollywood filmmakers like their women like they like their coffee: shrill, stupid and submissive. And usually not black.

item.title: [+615] Britain's new Internet law as bad as everyone's been saying
item.description: Mandlesons plans for the internet in the UK, the future of internet freedom looks grim

item.title: [+600] Video Report Card Ripped Up, Anti-Gaming Group Closes Doors
item.description: The National Institute on Media and the Family, the anti-gaming organization behind the MediaWatch Video Game Report Card, has closed its doors.

item.title: [+562] Man visits every country on earth in record time
item.description: An Indian businessman has visited all 194 countries on earth in a record six years, 10 months and seven days. But the holiday snaps to show for it are less than gripping...

item.title: [+547] Earth's Weather Like You Have Never Seen It Before
item.description: This video shows Earth's weather from August 17 to August 26, 2009. It also shows how beautiful this planet is, and how insignificant we are.

item.title: [+489] MPAA: Copyright Treaty Critics Hate Hollywood
item.description: If you don’t back a copyright treaty being negotiated in secret, you must want to destroy Hollywood, its blockbuster movies and all the jobs they create. At least that’s the message from the Motion Picture Association of America.

item.title: [+466] How to Run Chrome OS as a Virtual Machine
item.description: Itching for some Chrome OS? Well, we all are, but you might be a bit disappointed at the fact that while Google has open-sourced its progress on the OS so far, the version that is currently available for download seems eons behind what Google showed off at its event yesterday. Still, if you just have to see it for yourself...

item.title: [+463] One Person Dead in Miley Cyrus Bus Wreck - But Miley's Okay
item.description: Virginia State Police say one person was killed when a tour bus belonging to Miley Cyrus overturned, but the 16-year-old "Hannah Montana" star was not on board.

item.title: [+451] Microsoft roadmap puts Windows 8 in 2012
item.description: Microsoft should once again release its next mainstream version of Windows about three years after the last, a roadmap obtained this week reveals. The schedule has the major revision, tentatively titled "Windows 8," launching in 2012 or about three years after Windows 7. It will purportedly keep in step with a rhythm developed by Microsoft...

item.title: [+442] The Children of the World, in pictures
item.description: 20 years after the United Nations adopted the Convention on the Rights of the Child, multitudes of children across the globe are still suffering from poverty, abuse and disease. Each year, 4 million babies die before they are a month old, 150 million children are engaged in child labor, more than 500 million have been affected by violence...

item.title: [+435] Five ways Wal-mart in China is way different than America
item.description: What ensued was an overstimulating experience that was probably far worse than bargaining away a chilly afternoon. Following are five observations I made on the differences between Wal-mart in China and the U.S., though I'm sure there are many more.

item.title: [+425] Rare Dune Concept Art
item.description: Artist Chris Foss is known for his visionary presentation of future technology and weird vistas. His cool vision of the future led him to be asked to work on production designs for Alejandro Jodorowsky's uncompleted Dune movie, in the mid 1970s, and later on Ridley Scott's Alien and Superman: The Movie.

item.title: [+417] WTF: Man to Wed 2D Virtual Girl in Real Life
item.description: While playing the game, Love Plus, a guy met one of the virtual girls named Nene Anegasaki and fell in love with her. The man’s interest grew and now they're getting married.

item.title: [+410] The Amazing Spinning Sign Samurai Wows Fourth Street
item.description: Dude takes his sign holding job to a higher realm -- a freakin' signage samurai.
